name: Who's Who in Nursery Rhymes Trivia Game | Kid Lit General | 10 Questions

questions.text: Mary, Mary Quite Contrary had a _______.
questions.explanation:
garden.

	Mary, Mary, quite contrary, how does your garden grow? With silver bells and cockle shells and pretty maids all in a row.

questions.text: Where did Peter keep his wife?
questions.explanation:
in a pumpkin shell.

	Peter, Peter, pumpkin eater, had a wife and couldn't keep her. He put her in a pumpkin shell, and there he kept her very well.

questions.text: In his nursery rhyme, Wee Willie Winkie wore _______.
questions.explanation:
a nightgown.

	Wee Willie Winkie runs through the town, upstairs and downstairs in his nightgown. Rapping at the windows, calling through the locks: "Are the children in their beds? It's almost eight o'clock!"

a dog.

	Old Mother Hubbard went to the cupboard to get her poor dog a bone. But when she got there, the cupboard was bare, and so her poor dog had none.

questions.text: The Old Woman Who Lived in a Shoe had too many _______.
questions.explanation:
children.

	There was an old woman who lived in shoe. She had so many children that she didn't know what to do.

questions.text: Mary's lamb was as white as _______.
questions.explanation:
snow.

	Its fleece was white as snow.

questions.text: In the song that begins "Sing a song of sixpence," how many blackbirds were baked in a pie?
questions.explanation:
24.

	Four and twenty blackbirds baked in a pie.

questions.text: What did the Queen of Hearts bake?
questions.explanation:
some tarts.

	The Queen of Hearts she made some tarts, all on a summer's day. The Knave of Hearts, he stole the tarts, and took them clean away.

questions.text: Whom can one see at Banbury Cross?
questions.explanation:
a fine lady.

	Ride a cock horse to Banbury Cross to see a fine lady upon a white horse. With rings on her fingers and bells on her toes, she shall have music wherever she goes.

questions.text: What did Jack Be Nimble jump over?
questions.explanation:
a candlestick.

	Jack be nimble, Jack be quick, Jack jump over a candlestick.
